definition: To experience a series of challenging or difficult events, often implying a prolonged and intense process. It is commonly used to describe enduring or going through a demanding period, such as a difficult phase in life, a challenging task, or a grueling experience.

examples.german: Ich musste eine schwierige Zeit durchmachen.
examples.english: I had to go through a difficult time.

examples.german: Er musste eine harte Ausbildung durchmachen.
examples.english: He had to go through a tough training.

examples.german: Wir müssen alle diese Prüfung durchmachen.
examples.english: We all have to go through this exam.

examples.german: Die Stadt hat schwere Zeiten durchgemacht.
examples.english: The city has gone through difficult times.
